Reviews.Title: Foscam FI9821W Review
Reviews.Author: Max
Reviews.Content: Foscam FI9821W Megapixel HD 1280 x 720p H.264 Wireless/Wired Pan/Tilt IP Camera with IR-Cut Filter - 26ft Night Vision and 2.8mm Lens (70° Viewing Angle) - WhiteI own three Foscam 8910W cameras which work well, but I was in the market for an upgrade to an HD camera.  I went with the FI9821W, which has resulted in some minor problems for me personally, but given the feedback on cam-it.org, a widely used support forum for interested ip cam enthusiasts, others who have bought the FI9821W are doing far worse.I'll say that the camera does significantly improve bandwidth usage using the H.264 compression.  However I have the feeling that the compression is set too high in the software with no way to adjust it.  Although the image size is HD (1280X720) the image quality is definitely NOT HD.  It's more standard resolution quality than HD.  With no way to solve the compression problem, I think I'm stuck with a standard resolution camera at an HD price.As for the firmware, I've had my camera up for a little over two weeks and noticed that the preset positions get corrputed and the camera ends up pointing off to some other random position, which makes the PTZ functions useless if you're using the camera to monitor an area unattended.If you've previously purchased a Foscam camera you'll know that the web interface is somewhat less than attractive.  The new interface is MUCH better and works fine over Firefox with the installed addin or IE.Given some of the problems I've experienced and some of the stories I've read from other users, I'd put your purchase on hold until the camera issues are resolved.  Check back to the forum at cam-it.org for good reviews and progress on improvements.

Reviews.Title: This camera is not PRODUCTION ready
Reviews.Author: S. Rothenberg
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 10 days ago directly from FOSCAM because it was not available yet on AMAZON.  I have had numerous issues with it (locked up 4 times in 10 days, sent continuous motion activated emails even if completely covered, required power recycle each lockup time, unable to restart automatically after power cycle at the same "home" position). Check out FOSCAM's own forum at: [...] to see even more "issues".  I had much better luck with their earlier model FI8910.This camera is not PRODUCTION READY!  Just returned it to FOSCAM today.

Reviews.Title: Generally better than the FI9820W
Reviews.Author: Dale "DaleDJ"
Reviews.Content: I had a FI9820W that FOSCAM replaced with a FI9821W because after three replacements the 9820 audio still buzzed and popped when using WiFi to access the camera. In nearly all respects I find the FI9821W to be a better camera. The audio works properly. The pan/zoom speed is adjustable. The web interface is much improved. The night vision is also much improved.I do, however, observe to issues with the new model:1) The wider angle lens in the FI9821W results in much more spherical aberration than in the FI9820W. Straight vertical objects on the sides of the view are very noticeably curved. Frankly, I liked the smaller field-of-view lens on the FI9820W much better.2) Even though the web interface allows you to change the frame rate and key frame interval, no matter what values you enter the frame rate remains at 25 fps. My guess is that this is a firmware bug, but there is no new firmware available on FOSCAMs web site at the current time.My camera has System Firmware Version 1.2.1.1 and App Firmware Version 1.1.1.7.

Reviews.Title: Utter Garbage
Reviews.Author: Not My Real Name
Reviews.Content: I own multiple network cameras, including older foscam and Agasio (rebadged foscam). I was looking forward to this new "HD" camera being a step up from the rather basic, but effective previous products foscam has created.It is not. It is much much worse than any camera I have ever seen - for the last 10 years. The image quality is absolutely terrible. It might have a higher resolution sensor and be using h.264 to compress the image, but it doesnt matter, because whatever they are doing, they are doing it really really badly. My older foscam (vga) is much higher image quality.In addition, foscam have re-implemented their web UI, so that rather than having one simple web ui, you now have 2 separate ports that need to be redirected and are inter-dependent. There is also an activeX control or a chrome extension you can install (the default install does not work, you have to find it on the chrome store). Overall, the entire UI is much worse than the older versions.Additionally, the setup now requires a windows app (no mac) that scans the network for cameras and allows you to set them up. Except this utility is highly unstable and unnecessary because mdns has done this for years, and much more successfully.This is a terrible product. I am sending mine back for a refund and looking for alternatives.

Reviews.Title: Not Ready for Primetime
Reviews.Author: Ryan Kennedy
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera on 2/14/2013 to use as a baby monitor for our new infants room.  All was working well until 4/19/2013.  The camera crashed.  It would no longer respond on the wireless (or wired) networks.  I performed a factory reset, which did nothing.  After holding in the reset button for over 90 seconds the camera still did not reset.  The IP camera tool does not find the camera on the network, and the DHCP server doesn't get a request from the camera via WiFi or Ethernet.  I have plugged a computer into the ethernet port, and it works correctly.  Waiting on an RMA or refund.  Two months of functionality is NOT acceptable.

Reviews.Title: First IP Cam for use as baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Kristopher Makey
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to be used as a baby monitor alternative.  The setup instructions were clear but rely on certain level of tech savvy that isn't universal.  For what it's worth, if you expect to view the camera from anywhere in the world you need to setup port forwarding and IP reservation on your router for both the media and the "normal" port.  Once you have the port forwarding setup correctly, you need to login to the camera and ensure the ports you forwarded match up (default ports for a single camera are 88 and 888).The software they provide "IPCamera" is convenient enough to help you connect to the camera initially and really other than the work the router I found their administrative UI + instructions with pictures to be "good enough".  I really had no difficulty getting stuff working through their stated supported scenarios.Now to the sticking points.  Since I'm using this camera as a baby monitor, I wanted to setup multiple devices to view and listen in on the camera.  Finding apps that met my desires for each of my devices was more work that I initially anticipated, I will come back to this.Another downside, I get a certain base level of "crackle" over the audio feed that doesn't bother me but might be a problem for you.Now, onto apps:  First off I should describe my particular problem.  I am a Microsoft products user, as such, standard things like monitoring through Windows OS/IE worked right out of the box and were easy while others like getting monitoring through my Windows Phone 8 were a trial.  For straight "Windows" and IE this setup was brain dead simple (especially once I had the ddns link working).  I just hit the ddns site on each regular windows PC, logged in to test everything worked and the audio/video quality was good.  I was able to get good video and audio quality from my wireless-cable-(Seattle)->internet->Alaska.On Windows 8 RT (Surface) I tried a few different apps but I decided to stick with and install/pay for CameraKaze.  I haven't tested a connection through the internet, in this case I'm using Wireless->Router->Wireless connection as my Surface(s) are going to my primary baby monitoring devices when at home.  The Audio seems one-way through this app (but it's the right direction, camera to viewer) and the video doesn't properly resize when snapped, but for 5.00/install I'm not going to complain too much since the app included features like in-network detection and audio and it works on ARM.  I also have a Surface Pro (but pro uses "traditional" windows, so the IE plugin is great and what I want).On my Windows 8 Phone I tried several apps and could not get them to work. I finally settled on NetCam Pro.  I paid 30.00 for this guy, the audio doesn't work and honestly the interface sucks...but it does work without me needing to connect directly to the network so it fulfills the minimal requirement (and honestly the other app options I was able to demo wouldn't work).  My hope here is to use this app to do "baby-sitter spying" so it was a requirement that I could use DDNS to connect instead of using the raw IP (ie, checking on the sitter when we go out...when we eventually cross that bridge of hiring a sitter). It's good enough, but if you're looking for good Camera support on Windows Phone 8, the apps that are available right now don't seem to be of great quality.  I suspect the supported fruit and robot apps work better given there's a broader audience in those eco-systems.I give this product a 4*, they have actually have reasonable support forums, the hardware quality seems there (and with the flash update at least) the software pretty much works as advertised.  It's not a 5* because honestly I think their instructions on port-forwarding are not enough for "the mere mortal" and that audio-crackle is something they probably could have solved by having either better filtering on the mic gain or a controllable "minimal threshold" that could be set in the camera administration.

Reviews.Title: Worked for 2 months then DIED
Reviews.Author: Randy Frey
Reviews.Content: Is this camera worth $160? Absolutely NOT. I bought this foscam camera for the HD quality. It worked for two months then malfunctioned. I bought four Wansview $50 cameras over a year ago and they are still working to this day. The foscam camera is in a constant reboot loop. I tried reseting multiple different ways and it still just keeps rebooting. Amazon will not accept returns after one month. I will not be purchasing any more foscam products:( And shame on amazon for not accepting a return for a faulty product.

Reviews.Title: Dead after Firmware Update
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo Henrique de Souza
Reviews.Content: The camera is fine, I have bought 6 of them, however after a new firmware update, 2 of them got dead. I did the update as instructed, with the cameras plugged by network cable, but I just lost them after updated. They never turned on again. As I am in Brazil, there's no point to s*** them back to USA to have them replaced, so I just lost my money. Never will buy them from Foscam anymore.

Reviews.Title: OK but DIFFICULT and BUGGY
Reviews.Author: Kenneth B. Almond
Reviews.Content: I'm a software engineer and on a daily basis write the type of software that provides access to this camera.I'm here to tell you that it is some of the WORST, BUGGIEST code I've seen in a commercial product - and the company has not fixed it as of June 6th with update 1.1.1.13.They are pretending its a user problem, the documentation is DISMAL (I'm an engineer and had trouble figuring it out).The camera is cute and I love it but the utter lack of responsibility by the company to deliver software that operates - e.g. live up to the list of features promised - is worrisome and leads me to suggest a boycott.  This kind of corporate misleading should not be allowed.

Reviews.Title: Just so bad it's funny
Reviews.Author: S G Woodward
Reviews.Content: Software on the camera is so bad and undergoing so many (often failed) updates from the manufacturer.Search around a little before you buy - make sure you find the (at time of writing) 68 page plus issues list maintained on the US distributor / manufacturers websiteExamples - recording on the SD card crashes the camera (kid you not), wifi connection drops out, emails on motion sends the wrong picture (10hrs old)

Reviews.Title: 1 Defective Unit Returned, Returning 2nd after Firmware update
Reviews.Author: N. Routsong "Routy"
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this camera. I have multiple other foscam cameras and was excited to "upgrade" to a higher resolution. My first FI9821W loaded up once, spun around and I thought all was good. I was unable to find it on the IP Camera Tool so I unplugged it to try it again - it didn't move... it is supposed to swivel around and do it's dance after being plugged in. Called Foscam, unit was determined to be defective. I returned the unit to Amazon. Received my 2nd one through another seller on Amazon. Seemed to work well, besides the firmware allowing anyone access to the camera, even without a password... (see last straw below) we went on vacation and on the 4th day or so that camera was blank. I returned home to find the cable and camera both quite hot. So I unplugged it and let it cool down. I plugged it in again and it worked for another 30min or so. It has had spotty performance throughout the day as I have troubleshot it - so I am returning this one as well.Last Straw:I installed the latest firmware that was supposed to fix the security vulnerabilities. After install, it can no longer connect to WiFi connections... Seriously?Bottom Line:Foscam has put this camera out without thorough testing. How could you release a camera that can be logged into without a password? Then - how do you release a patch to that bug that breaks the WiFi capabilities?! On a positive note, the non-hd version of this camera is working well. I will be ordering that one and hopefully forgetting about this experience.

Reviews.Title: Seems to work well once it's set up.
Reviews.Author: Theresa
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cameras to provide a live feed at a remote location. I'm not doing anything fancy - no recording, motion detection, or email alerts - just plain live video viewable from anywhere.Pros: Seems well built, despite the plastic housing. The pan/tilt motor runs quietly. Good quality picture. Easily set up to view from my Android phone and the internet (with networking know-how; probably not so easy for your basic user). Foscam support was friendly and helpful, but could have been better - more on that later. The web interface is easy to navigate (BUT...).Cons: The web interface is quite buggy. This is something that could be fixed in a future update, but it is a serious issue that needs to be addressed SOON. When I called support because clicking any camera control buttons on the webpage did absolutely nothing when logged in as admin (the "operator" account worked, but I needed to flip the view for ceiling mount), they attempted to flash a new firmware version to my camera. It didn't take. It would start applying the update, then kick us back to the login page. After several attempts, they had me factory reset the camera. We logged in and, viola! The controls worked! I thanked them and let them go. Fast forward 10 minutes, and I realize I need to mirror the image. It no longer responds. I wasted HOURS factory resetting, reconfiguring, encountering issue after issue. I still can't get the newer firmware 1.1.1.13 (current is 1.1.1.11) to install, but I also can't find it on their support page, so maybe it is pre-release or something. If you try to log into the camera's web interface  as a non-admin and you don't have the plugin installed, you will get a "Permission denied" error (I get why, but they should make the error more understandable, or allow login and redirect to an installation page). Also, if you are trying to read their documentation, "Engrish" abounds - have fun with that.TIP - THIS IS WHAT CAUSED MY INTERFACE PROBLEMS: Do NOT use special characters in your password!! It will let you do it, but it breaks all the controls on the "Live Video" tab and makes it so you can't change the video settings. If you already have special characters in your password, you can change it and restore the functionality. I hope I can save some headaches! :) I find it odd that Foscam support apparently did not know this, so I will be bringing this to their attention.Other: They provided a mount, of sorts. It worked well enough to wedge the camera into a drop tile ceiling, but it's a plastic bracket with a few predefined positions. It's a nice touch, but expect to find some other means to mount your camera.In short, if the buggy interface issues are addressed I will happily raise my rating.

Reviews.Title: Not ready for prime time
Reviews.Author: Mary C. Clark
Reviews.Content: installs ok into its own software; but the image is reversed and there is a 1 second video lag.  This was WIRED!Was a devil of a time to install into iSpy; the Foscam forum was not all that helpful and full of complaints.  The video from this camera does not come close to the Huacam cameras; and the folks at Huacam tell me they will be releasing an indoor HD PTZ very soon.  So I will wait.  Sent this one back.

Reviews.Title: This is the perfect baby monitor I've been searching for!
Reviews.Author: Robert Beeman
Reviews.Content: I was previously using a 2.4GHz wireless monitor to watch our infant son, but it was creating havoc with our wifi network. I wanted a wifi device that I could display on my computer monitor, iphone, ipad, and access from the internet. This cam fits the bill perfectly at a very reasonable cost. Much of my experience with this is in relation to my two other cameras: IP cam Logitech Alert 750e Outdoor Master Security Camera System with Night Vision (961-000337) and baby monitor Infant Optics Add-On Camera for DXR-5 2.4 Ghz Video Monitor (DXR-871)What I like:* More than one person/device can access it simultaneously. My wife and I both like to keep an eye on our little one. Also, sometimes I'm watching him on my computer screen, but then I want to run downstairs so I can continue monitoring on my phone.* With additional software, it integrates well with other existing IP cameras.* Participates in my wifi network, instead of destroying it.* Pan and tilt are great features that I never had before.* Night vision is bright with great visibility.* Very nicely priced when compared to other wifi/internet cams.* Wide screen field of view is very appreciated after watching my Logitech Alert cam for the past couple of years.* It's portable enough to move it from room to room, but also versatile enough to permanently mount in the corner of a room.What I don't like:* Much more difficult to configure than a typical baby monitor or consumer oriented IP cam. They aren't too bad for someone with any kind of home networking experience, but if you don't it may be a little intimidating.* Apps for mobile devices require an additional purchase.* Included software is not good at all in my opinion. I'd highly recommend purchasing Blue Iris to manage it, especially if you have other IP cams.I made sure to update the firmware to the latest (v1.1.1.13 at the time) the day I received the cam. Issues previous reviewers had with the camera may have been resolved by it.

Reviews.Title: Gat Camara System
Reviews.Author: William Whitehead
Reviews.Content: Bouht 1sxt. one and got great support from Foscam. Camera work perfvect. After changing from wireless to wired Foscam Tech. supportg assisted in ho it u. They have a Great Tech support and Camera

Reviews.Title: Quality camera, easy set up
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: After I received my Foscam F19821W camera, I was able to get everything setup within an hour.  The instructions that came with it were easy to follow and the instructions provided on Foscam's website were a great back up (even though I didn't have to use the website).  Very impressed with the video quality, even after going to the WiFi mode.  Camera is very responsive and the two way audio feature is really neat.  I easily set up the remote viewing feature and the video quality is still great even though the response time for turning the camera is a couple seconds behind.  I can still live with it.  I downloaded the app TinyCam to my smartphone and again was able to set it up with ease.  Again, I am very impressed with the quality of the camera and the ease of setting it up.  A great buy for the price!  I plan on getting a couple more down the road!

Reviews.Title: Both cameras problematic
Reviews.Author: J. W. Coleman "OmensAuthor"
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these Foscam cameras and both have been nothing but continuous headaches. The photo quality is NOT HD and the resolution rather poor. Of both cameras, one has no color - the images are black and white with only a tinting of color if you adjust the colors/brightness, etc. to the extremes. And that camera (which has the latest firmware installed) now doesn't respond at all - can't log into it and it doesn't show up on the network (unless it's physically connected via ethernet). The other camera had PERFECT color but, after two months, went into an endless 'patrol' mode, where the camera just pans continuously. Can't log into that camera, either. Total waste of time and money, unfortunately. I contacted Foscam and they advised me to install another firmware upgrade, but they already HAVE the latest firmware upgrade and without being able to log into the cameras, I can't install anything. I have four older Foscam cameras that are all working perfectly, but with the crappy resolution inherent in those older cameras. It's too bad we don't get what we pay for in this day and age. I am looking for options to replace my Foscams permanently. I have lost all faith in Foscam.

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY THIS CAMERA
Reviews.Author: media
Reviews.Content: Video quality is good at daytime and night time...motion sensor is so sensitive even on lowest setting...Always crash on wi-fi setting so now I just connect it with wired setting with CAT5, I used powerline adapter to connect it from 1st floor to the router on the 2nd floor. Another set back is the SD card....it doesn't delete old recording...it just stop recording when only 250 MB space remains in the card. I tried 16 GB and 4 GB...waste of money....I only use it now for surveillance only...other features ok...pan tilt is fine...it works using my samsung galaxy 2...but not on iphone or ipad...doesn't last a week you need to reboot the camera coz it crashes...AFTER 5 MONTHS THE CAMERA I BOUGHT STOPPED WORKING..NOW I'M TRYING TO GET THE 1 YEAR WARRANTY THAT FOSCAM ADVERTISE ON THE BOX AND ON THEIR WEBSITE THEY EVEN MENTIONED THAT IF THE DISTRIBUTOR DECLINE THE WARRANTY, THEY WILL WORK IT OUT TO PROVIDE ONE..BUT BOTH OF THEM IS DECLINING THE WARRANTY..BOTH OF THEM IS SAYING THAT ITS THE OTHER ONE WHO SHOULD PROVIDE IT..SO DON'T BUY ANY FOSCAM PRODUCT...

Reviews.Title: product not ready for general release
Reviews.Author: Thomas Y. Pocock
Reviews.Content: This camera is not up to the standards of their previous cameras.I could not get it to connect to my WIFI.It turns off by other 4 cameras when it tries to connect to WIFI.It also is not compatible with the FoscamPro app for the iphone.I have returned it.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8921 good and bad
Reviews.Author: JKM
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these for my home security to be used with a Uverse 2wire router. Setup was easy per the instructions. Picture quality is very good in good light but night vision is only fair with difficulty in recognizing people/objects beyond about 10 feet. There are several Utube videos about setting the camera up for motion detection, email alerts and remote viewing. I spent several days on remote viewing setup unsuccessfully until I added static IP through my ISP. Now that works fine, but I still haven't got the motion detection/email alert to work yet. Wireless coverage has been good throughout my home and garage. I tried 3 apps for my iPad/Iphone and IP Cam viewer works best for me. Foscam includes a builtin DDNS address for each camera which I ended up using for remote viewing instead of a third party address.As a baby/pet monitor this camera would work fine either in home or remote (once you get it setup). For surveillance detection alerts, I'm looking at other software solutions (i.e. Vitamin D) if I can't get the Foscam email alerts to work for me. If you're not an IT professional be prepared to spend a lot of time getting familiar with your router and port forwarding. When my ISP (ATT) sent someone out to set up the static IP, he had to call tech support to walk him through it. Even had to wait on hold like everyone else.I would recommend the FI8921 camera as a good DIY alternative to an expensive wired professionally installed surveillance system. Amazon service was excellent as always. Be sure your camera has the latest firmware (Feb) as mine didn't.EDIT:  8/30/13Both cameras quit working after a very brief power outage. Foscam community forum indicates this is a common problem with no ready solution. If yours are still working - great. I will replace with wired IP cameras of much better quality.

Reviews.Title: Security Issues w/Firewall, SMTP Issues - Otherwise a great camera.
Reviews.Author: TimCO
Reviews.Content: EDIT: 8/27/13 - I discovered that the Firewall Whitelist/Blacklist Functionality in the FI9821W ONLY blocks access to the HTTP/HTTPS ports. i.e. IP addresses NOT on the whitelist can still access the data stream. I notified Foscam of this and they stated it was by design. I was relying on the whilelist to block ALL access outside the whitelist. I have since unplugged my camera when it's not in use and blocked it from the internet. This is with the version info below. Taking away one star for poor security.System firmware version:1.2.1.1App firmware version:1.1.1.13Web version:2.0.1.1Plug-in version:2.0.1.3I've been reasonably pleased with the FI9821W. Prior to buying it, I bought and returned a FI8910W because of constant crashing.FI9821W Pros* Image quality and resolution looked good on 1080p laptop display.* The web interface is intuitive and easy to use.* The interface provides the ability to rename default users and to define multiple user classes (i.e. admin, power user, view only).* Software provides the ability to rename device and define ports.* Built in SSL support.* I was able to quickly setup 3rd party apps for my Android phone. I ended up buying "IP Cam Viewer" after trying several tools.* Included hardware mount and software mirror/flip options provide many possible orientations.* Web interface works well with IE10 and Chrome. Both require plugin.* Smooth panning.* IR worked very well even in complete darkness.FI9821W Cons* Field of view on the FI8910W more narrow than the FI9821W. I preferred the FI9810W view.* SMTP mail doesn't work for me. Mail functions do not correctly identify the camera after passing EHLO causing problems with some SMTP servers - FW 1.1.1.13* Device advertised WPS support but WPS is not mentioned in any of the documentation.* For wireless encryption passwords, "System prohibits the & and = symbols". This wasn't a problem on the FI8910W.* Ethernet cable provided was flat and recoiled into a spool making it only good for setup. You'll need a real cable if you want to go wired.* Provided DDNS solution makes cameras easily detected on the internet.* Software did not provide the ability to disable the built in LEDs.* I wasn't able to make the OEM Samsung Galaxy S3 browser work with the camera's built in web server. I was able to get Chrome to open the web site but couldn't see the video stream,Overall, I'm very pleased with the FI9821W. If you're interested in the FI8910W, check out the Amazon page for the FI8910W to see my review of it and why it was returned.

Reviews.Title: Not ready
Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: I have several other foscam cameras around the house that work well, however this one was too flaky. Frequent lockups, change position with reset, not compatible with the software I was using with other foscams, picture quality not much better than lower resolution cams, email option should include video clip and pictures, emails with pictures did not display correctly on iPad (other foscams work fine). Returned a couple days after purchase.Update 2/3: received email that firmware has been updated to fix, but overall still prefer the other foscams functioning and reliability that use picture formats instead of video.

Reviews.Title: Nice optics - Horrible audio problem
Reviews.Author: M. Sanders
Reviews.Content: Nice camera, very good picture, outstanding night vision coverage w/ included IR (Lit up my front yard, driveway and 3 houses across the street!)First day, I was in a hurry, so I set it up, put it in a window, started recording and left home. Upon my return I reviewed the footage and to my surprise, this little camera had captured a thief trying to break into a neighbor's home. He only stopped when he looked up right into the camera and realized that he was on security camera.This camera earned its great, but the audio "snap-crackle-pop" ruins what could be Foscam's Best Seller.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the price-easy setup
Reviews.Author: Andrea Barbisnagy
Reviews.Content: Purchased 8 of this cameras -main reason being the ability to monitor my house from anywhere in the world. I can tell you that the picture quality is excellent, even in the night conditions or bright sun. pretty easy to set it up within the reach of the WiFi network,but when needed to be configured for the internet, i found myself in difficulty. Thanks god, their customer service is a notch above other companies, and their representative, Sandra was more than willingly offered to help, and in a matter of minutes-ta da! everything was working .Thanks Foscam for a good product and a great customer service.

Reviews.Title: GREAT AS BABYCAM
Reviews.Author: B. Young
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome.  Ignore the negative reviews, as most of those people must not have any basic knowledge of networking.  All I have to say that this product is absolutely fantastic for us.  We have it above our twins' crib and it provides fantastic Video (including infared at night) and sound!  I have installed the Foscam Chrome plugin on all my PC's and I have no issues watching the crib from on our local network or from the Internet.  Since it is a standard IP camera, I have also installed the app 'IPCamViewer' on all of my android devices for $5 (My Samsung GSIII, My wife's Samsung GSIII, and my Nexus 10) and now I can use an of my already purchased devices as baby monitors.  I can Tilt and Pan, have access to infrared for night viewing, and can listen in on that room all from any number of devices.  I did a TON of research on baby monitors, and the functionality that this IPCam provides for us is unparalleled.It truly is a great product.

Reviews.Title: Not for ambient light inside
Reviews.Author: Its "Munchiniwa"
Reviews.Content: This was fairly easy to connect via Ethernet cable but it constantly switches to Black & White. Even when I manually turn off the LEDs they somehow down the road come back on. When the LEDs are on, you only get a B&W; picture. I got it to use inside my house, in a corner of the ceiling pointing to the middle of the living room. I don't think I have a "dark" house. Three walls have large windows (sliding glass door, two 3' x 6' casement windows, and the other wall has two windows (4'x6' and 3'x6'). We are in Florida. There is a LOT of light. The picture quality (B&W;) is good.Haven't gotten the wireless to work consistently yet and don't have it going out of the house yet. The instructions are for a Cisco router and I have Airport. The three lights on the back that show power and Ethernet are quite bright. They actually light up the room at night when the lights are off. Also, the "Infrared" LEDs on the front are BRIGHT red and really light the place up. I have another infrared camera and you cannot see the LEDs at all whether they are on or off. Only by looking at the video can you tell.There is no stealth about this camera at all and if you were looking for a "silent witness" type of arrangement then this is not for you. The description says it has audio in and out and I thought it had a mic and speaker. No, it has jacks for a mic and speaker (and I'm not really sure about the speaker part whether you would need an amp or just the speaker).I guess there's a reason that is low-cost (relatively).

Reviews.Title: Needs improvement
Reviews.Author: Pascal Graziani
Reviews.Content: I bought the 8910W a couple months ago and it has been working fine.  So I need to install another camera so I thought I would try this 9821W because it's HD.With the 2 cameras side-by-side and focused on the same area, I thought this would be a great way to compare both in action.  But I couldn't get the HD to alarm and trigger even when the older one worked fine.Pros:1. The image is bigger and clearer.2. The web interface is all new and has a few improvements.Cons:1. The alarm requires a minimum of 5 seconds of motion before it triggers; that's too long.  5 seconds gives an intruder plenty of time to run across the camera's field of view and not trigger.  The older FI8910W only needs 1 second.2. The alarm sensitivity only has 3 setting; low, medium, and high which is not granular enough. The FI8910W sensitivity was on a scale of 1 - 10 which allowed for more accurate settings.3. The web app login requires a media port which is pre-populated.  Sometimes, the field is blank and you can't login and you have to reboot the camera. This is not convenient if the camera is mounted in an inconvenient location.The 9821 needs for field testing and Foscam needs to work out the bugs a little more.  I'm returning this one and going back to the FI8910W.

Reviews.Title: I have had it for a month, I can't find an app that I can view it from.
Reviews.Author: Linda Sunday
Reviews.Content: The tech's were great i helping me get it set up.  But since, I can't get it to record on the sd card.  I can't view it from anything except my laptop.  All the app's I've tried crash.  I am thinking about sending it back

Reviews.Title: Audio Issues .....
Reviews.Author: cdsanger
Reviews.Content: My application requires that the audio be synchronized with the video ... After several calls to Foscam I was finally told that this couldn't happen. I was using a wired connection, tried several ways of recording and at several resolutions. So if you don't mind the audio mis-tracking the video by +/- many seconds it's not a bad camera for the money ....The Android App is nice .... and the picture quality of OKHey, just trying to say SOMETHING good about it

Reviews.Title: Great indoor camera
Reviews.Author: D. Matick
Reviews.Content: Received on time and as described. Very good picture and is compatible to other monitoring software other than what comes with it. If your monitoring outside form inside behind a glass window the night vision doesn’t work very well as the IR reflects off the glass. Highly recommended for inside Monitoring

Reviews.Title: Foscam camera
Reviews.Author: holli
Reviews.Content: I like this camera , it is easy to use, and  customer service is helpful. It can be placed anywhere, once it is initially connected with the router. I bought this camera for added home security. I would recommend this camera for anyone to use. Very simple.

Reviews.Title: Not an improvement over older models
Reviews.Author: J. R. Conlin "da5ba6eadd0b4662f284728dae2ccefb"
Reviews.Content: After less than 24 hours, I'm really starting to dislike this camera.I had hoped this camera would replace an older FI9810 and give me some nice 1280x720 streaming. Unfortunately, this camera promises a lot more than it can readily deliver.After upgrading to the latest firmware and UI:1) Camera controls are SERIOUSLY laggy and fickle. Even connected to the LAN, camera responses can take upwards of a second before the motors engage, and the distance the motor travels can be arbitrary at best.2) low light images produce a LOT of noise. I know that this isn't a top of the line CCD and that the CPU is probably maxed, but under non-daylight levels, blacks tend to vary enough that my Linux Motion monitor triggers false positives from the distortions.3) MJPEG streaming output is limited to VGA quality (640x480). It does lossy conversion from 1280x720 to 640x480, so you get slightly more resolution thanks to pixel aliasing, but it's hardly what you'd expect.4) It is very difficult to find any information about the latest API. This means that the H.264 is useless for anything other than writing directly to the local SD card. And, no, there doesn't appear to be a way to access the SD card remotely, either. Granted, when you do find the docs, you'll see you need to send your user and password in clear text in the URL. Yeah, that's secure. ಠ_ಠ5) You can only view the media stream via a plugin. If you can't run the plugin, you can't see the camera output. You can dig around and try to find the MJPG stream (provided you can find any API documentation to point you how to do that.), but otherwise, you're dorked.5) The camera crashes, a lot. Right now, it's locked hard and unresponsive. That means when it breaks someone will have to go and manually reset it. Not really a good idea if you're trying to monitor something remotely, huh?This is not a tool you can rely on. This is an expensive, persnickety toy. I'd do better with a raspberry PI and some LEGO than this. Honestly, I'm going back to the older model since it works far better and more reliably than this "improved" version.

Reviews.Title: The best of an underwhelming lot?
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Nowak
Reviews.Content: These things are frustrating beasts.  On the one hand, they aren't horrendously expensive, and it seems almost impossible to find a universally loved camera that doesn't cost a lot of money.  And when they work, they work well.  But, the reliability is very suspect, and the technical support very iffy.  This is my 3rd camera from them.  The first one was an MJPEG model (the 8910), and that ran into the problem of a bright/complex picture would crash the camera.  (Reading through the FOSCAM forums, that problem seems to have been solved by some enterprising contributors after about 6 months of work.  Although FOSCAM technical help is spotty, there are some very good people on their forums, so go dig through there for useful info on any of the camera models).  Luckily that happened quickly enough for me to return the camera for a refund.The second one was a FI9821 V1, which worked great for 3.5 months in a semi-outdoor setting (inside a duck coop, hanging upside down from the ceiling).  The other day when moving it, unplugging it and plugging it back in, it went into an endless cycle of rebooting.  This seems to be a known issue (hopefully fixed in the latest firmware, which sadly I hadn't installed).  The unit is basically bricked.  That seems to be the consensus of the forum, and from Foscam technical support.  And sadly, it wasn't purchased from one of their providers, so it doesn't fall under warranty and the money is a write off.So, I have replaced it with this one, which although not being listed as V2 actually did come that way.  (I assume that they have run through the V1 stock at this point).  This time I have immediately updated the firmware, and purchased from Amazon which allegedly should get me the full year warranty, which I suspect I might need.  Again, it's working great now, but I don't have a strong feeling that it will be that way for the long haul.But, the thing is, even having eaten the cost of the first one, I don't see anything else out there that, reading the reviews, makes me think would work any better or more reliably for anywhere near this price.  And I need to keep an eye on my ducks, so there you go.  This still seems like the best of a mediocre market, and there's probably an opening out there for a company that can make a reasonably priced, reliable camera.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied Overall
Reviews.Author: Sharron Grodzinsky
Reviews.Content: Camera worked well.  Technical support at Foscam, Fred Jacobson, was very helpful.  The manual/guide could be clearer, I found it to be very confusing.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Android dude
Reviews.Content: great customer service and tech support, camera features are just what i need to view my property great buy!i can listen to what going on in my house, i like the pan feature that i can control from my iphone from anywhere. and it sends me snapshot photos of motion detection.

Reviews.Title: This camera Rocks !!
Reviews.Author: C. Sherer "adaddo"
Reviews.Content: All I can say is....Wow !!Spent a few hours attempting to set this up myself....:(my 2 connected routers were causing conflicts...Called Foscam..and they immediately found the issueAnd had me viewing remotely in 10 minutesYou guys Rock!!Love the cam

Reviews.Title: Foscam F19821 HD camera
Reviews.Author: Bt
Reviews.Content: Nice camera, good quality.  Tech support is helpful when needed.  Like the high definition clarity and remote access and ability to view multiple cameras on one page

Reviews.Title: Great Cameras quality
Reviews.Author: Maureen Migliorini
Reviews.Content: excellent cameras -- easy to use  great camera quality-- video quality good  pan tilt works great -- tech help is good -- easy phone access

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey L. Palmer
Reviews.Content: Works well, but help is needed for connection. Changing routers needs technical help. It helps us watch our cats when we are away.

Reviews.Title: foscam camera review
Reviews.Author: Mrunal
Reviews.Content: Customer service is good and camera functionality is great. we can view camera from any where in the world, greaway to get connected

Reviews.Title: So far so good.
Reviews.Author: Dennis R Volpe Jr
Reviews.Content: I had some trouble setting it up to be both wireless and to access it remotely through an app. The tech service folks at Foscam got me up and running in about 15 minutes!

Reviews.Title: nice cameras have
Reviews.Author: Lance
Reviews.Content: I have 11 of these and quality is good, clear picture. can view on any device.  Very happy would rec ommend to anyone.  EXCELLENT TECH SUPPORT

Reviews.Title: foscam fi9821w
Reviews.Author: Terry Bennett
Reviews.Content: Camera is great, support was very helpful in setting up everything.Good deal on Groupon, look around for when they offer sales.Night vision is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: FI9821W
Reviews.Author: RYAN
Reviews.Content: Price was great and camera quality is great.Great to be able to remote from any where in the world . I would refer this camera to anyone needing a great high quality camera.

Reviews.Title: very great foscam camrera and service
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: this camera works great. no complaints. customer service is a+love the way can pan up down left right and ability to hear and speak through the apphighly recomend this to everyone

Reviews.Title: Foscam F18910W
Reviews.Author: Chen Dong
Reviews.Content: The camera was easy to set up. The port forwarding can be tricky but the foscam customer service went through the process with me remotely and helped set up the whole thing. Very nice tech support.Now the camera is working nicely. The picture quality is nice. I can see my house anywhere I want from my phone now.

Reviews.Title: Foscam
Reviews.Author: kent morgan
Reviews.Content: The factory support for my camera was great.I like the motion detection feature of the camera and the night vision.I would recommend this camera to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Good Cameras for the money
Reviews.Author: M. Butindaro "M B 77"
Reviews.Content: Outfitted my whole house with these cameras.  I can check in remotely on my baby which is nice.  Easy to setup, descent support.

Reviews.Title: Foscam camera
Reviews.Author: Jerry Lynch
Reviews.Content: Cameras work well. Setup support is great.I look forward to accessing my cameras no matter where I am. Hard to describe the peace of mind provide by my " eye in the sky".

Reviews.Title: F198005W
Reviews.Author: Mary-Ann Guzik
Reviews.Content: The cost is reasonable and with a little help from Foscam I am able to view remotely efficiently.  Previous cameras record the motion of clouds, sunrise/sunset and flying bugs at night.  I look forward to seeing how this camera works.  I have also been surprised on how much data is used to send and then receive alarm photos.

Reviews.Title: Foscam camera
Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: I enjoy the camera because it is durable and constructed of heavy duty materials that are capable of withstanding harsh weather. I like the motion detection function as well as the night vision capability. The customer service reps at Foscom have been very helpful to me as well and assisted me in setting up the wireless function of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Foscam
Reviews.Author: Jimwen "jimwen"
Reviews.Content: Great camera, technical support.  Comes with unique IP address.  Straight forward for setting up.  Easy remote access.  Highly recommend.  Best value for web camera.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: pjensco
Reviews.Content: camera is very easy to view works excellent in low light conditions, can be seen from a smartphone from anywhere anytime also good quality videoI highly recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: foscam camera
Reviews.Author: Ronald Tengowski
Reviews.Content: Very happy with my new camera, and the technical help I received. Great features like zoom and panning. I do recommend this camera for your home or business.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: jeff
Reviews.Content: works great. best buy for the money. love that i can see my home on the iphone.I recommend this. great picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Would be Moderately Good for the Price if They Worked More than 3 Months.
Reviews.Author: sabin
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because it has a pretty good set of features for the price. The panning works great and has a wide range of travel, it has a built in dyndns and ftp upload in addition to SD card slot, highly configurable motion activation, talk back capability, a reasonably good interface and lots of other useful options.The audio quality is pretty bad, and the video quality isn't very impressive either, even on a LAN with the highest settings. However the night vision is quite good due to all the infrared LEDs. But considering all the other features, I would say it's better than expected for the price. I probably would have given it 3 or 4 stars if it lasted at least 2 years.HOWEVER, it abruptly stopped working after 3 months on the dot, caught in an infinite boot loop, it keeps doing its startup calibration routine over and over and there is apparently no way to fix it. While googling for a solution, I came across quite a few customers who have experienced the exact same problem. While these cameras no longer (I hope) have the ridiculously gaping security holes ( [...] ), it seems clear to me that the firmware was rushed to market with some very serious bugs that have ended up bricking a lot of these IP cameras.I contacted Foscam via their website, and may revise this review upwards if they are willing to replace it with a functional one with minimal cost and hassle.If you're willing to be a beta tester for Foscam and put up with some annoyances in return for the cheap price, this might be a good choice for you. But if you require a reasonable level of dependability, I would stay away from this camera and probably this brand.

Reviews.Title: Good when it works
Reviews.Author: nottarts23
Reviews.Content: Ordered for use wireless/ IP camera and baby monitor.  It is not the easiest  camera to set up.  I'm not computer expert but it was not easy.  Had to buy new wireless router because older model wouldn't port forward.  Foscam tech support was great.  It took some time to get thru to rep but they made sure everything was set up correctly. Tech support even walked me thru how to get camera hooked up to app for iPhone and iPad.my camera ended up having hardware issue and would continuously reset.I purchased thru amazon camera went bad just after ninety day return policy.  Had to contact seller and manufacturer to see who to return camera to.  Not easy trying to contact seller.  They were not very helpful at all....I have sent back to foscam for replacement.  I hope to have better luck with next one.

Reviews.Title: Foscam
Reviews.Author: Don Mayer
Reviews.Content: I really like these cameras and the tech support is excellent. I have four cameras and they all work perfect on my iphone. I like the wireless feature very much .

Reviews.Title: foscam camera
Reviews.Author: Kathryn
Reviews.Content: I like features and the price. I like the quality. I like everything about the camera. i highly recommend this camera. I like the support. The support staff is very knowledgable and polite.

Reviews.Title: it is great so far
Reviews.Author: victor
Reviews.Content: Viewing is great, audio is great, and easy to turn on and offprice was not cheap, but you get what you pay for,best thing is 24/7 support which makes it worth the price

Reviews.Title: Foscam
Reviews.Author: Lynn
Reviews.Content: good camera, easy to use. Good price and easy to access. can view the camera from any where..Recommend this camera to EVERYBODY!

Reviews.Title: foscam camera
Reviews.Author: muhamad siregar
Reviews.Content: picture is good for ip cam under $100 customer service excellent but you just have to be in queue for over 30 min overall is very good i will buy again

Reviews.Title: Great while it works -- UPDATED: Foscam replaced my broken cameras
Reviews.Author: BC1970
Reviews.Content: I've upgraded my review from a 1 star to a 4 star.  After contacting Foscam to address the issue of the broken cameras I learned that the cameras must be purchased from Foscam, not a 3rd party seller, in order for them to repair the camera at no cost due to the overheating issue.  I exchanged several emails with them and they eventually honored the warrantee.  They replaced all 3 cameras (version 1.0) with 3 new cameras (version 2.0 -- which fixed the overheating issue that damaged the v.1 cameras).  They have shipped the cameras and once I get them I'll reinstall them and see how long they last.  Foscam assured me that the overheating issue has been resolve.  I hope so, I like the cameras a lot.Below was my original post with 1 star:I have 3 of these cameras that were purchased around June 2013 and 5 months (the last one broke today Oct 11th) later they are all broken.  The first one suddenly stopped working and looks like it keeps restarting itself (the same routine it goes thru when you first plug it in, but it's nonstop).  Within the next 2 months they all were doing this same thing.  It was nice while it worked, but having 3 with the exact same problems is telling in my humble opinion.  I won't be buying these again if they only last 5 months.  It's shameful to have any product break in that short amount of time (especially when multiple cameras break in the same way).

Reviews.Title: Support Review Foscam Camera 19821
Reviews.Author: Phillip
Reviews.Content: I just installed the Foscam 19821 Camera and it is working great.  The picture is very good, the color is excellent.  I received excellent support form Foscam during the installation of this camera system.  They made the process work and the friendly and professional Team made sure to answer all of my questions.  HOOAH for Foscam!!!

Reviews.Title: foscam
Reviews.Author: L. Castle
Reviews.Content: So far have been very satisfied with the 3 cameras we've ordered, and the service we've gotten at the 800#.Like the wireless feature, and the ability to receive emails any time it recognizes motion.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Camera
Reviews.Author: Craig
Reviews.Content: Camera's show a good picture day and night. Highly recommend these cameras. the cameras are priced reasonably for the quality of picture.

Reviews.Title: Great device
Reviews.Author: cll320
Reviews.Content: Really good device for the money and the online service is the best - it set up really well and will use it often

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: roy t. joseph
Reviews.Content: This camera allows you to view and have security from anywhere in the world !  I can view the camera from my smartphone too !.. I was having some trouble setting up the smartphone app connection and the support tech at foscam was able to remotely access my computer and help setup the whole thing. I learned some stuff along the way too !  Excellent camera and support team !

Reviews.Title: Foscam camera
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: cameras work well, good customer service. wireless remote access clear picture pan and tilt can save alarms to desk top folder. I recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: W. Byrd
Reviews.Content: This is a nice HD camera for the price.  Unfortunately I've had to replace one already due to a boot loop error.  The place is local here in Houston and it was a quick 2 minute exchange.  The camera takes great video indoors and the night vision is also really good.  The IR lights give off a slight red glow, but nothing major.  I have one shining through a window looking outdoors.  This one does good in the daylight and even in the low light settings.  However, once the LEDs kick in, the window is like a mirror and nothing is visible.  Overall, a good purchase.

Reviews.Title: technology today
Reviews.Author: Razvan marcu
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with this product, I bought this for my sister, to be used as a baby monitor, but before I gave it to her I tested it a little bit around the house. It has a really good daytime and nighttime image, you can use your smart phone to log on the camera from wherever you are, and watch what is on the other end.

Reviews.Title: Problems with First One.....
Reviews.Author: LTC STEVEN S. FITZGERALD "S. Scott FitzGerald"
Reviews.Content: Worked as advertised out of the box, stopped working after about 6~8 weeks, currently working thru replacement or changing over to a different product - currently assessing 2nd version of same camera - it still works.....

Reviews.Title: Great WebCam/Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: Robbie "Robbie"
Reviews.Content: At first I was a little wary about purchasing this IP Cam after reading all the negative reviews but I am glad I did.I work in IT so while the documentation was not super clear and getting it to work remotely it a bit more advanced it was not difficult.  I think the quality is really great and I love the pan and tilt function for checking out the room.  My wife and I are planning to use this as a baby monitor and it works perfect for that.  Finding a app to work with our iOS devices has been more of a challenege just because there are so many options with varying functions to each.  I look forward to getting more of these in the future to monitor the house.

Reviews.Title: Good ip cam
Reviews.Author: bridge
Reviews.Content: This camera is a much better camera than the foscam FI8918W. In my opinion the image resolution is far greater and makes it a worthy purchase.

Reviews.Title: Not easy to set up on a home network for viewing over the internet.
Reviews.Author: Centurion1211
Reviews.Content: I have AT&T; DSL. Been working on getting this to work the way I wanted and it was advertised ever since it arrived.  For awhile it looked like I was going to have to lay out twice the price of the camera for paid AT&T; support and a new wireless router.  Finally was able to view the camera image from work for the first time today, but then it stopped working until I got home to "reboot" the camera.Still thinking about sending it back ...

Reviews.Title: Much improvement over the pervious versions
Reviews.Author: Frequent Buyer
Reviews.Content: Good product with good video quality, easy user interface, a little expensive for now but hope it will drop in price.

Reviews.Title: POOR APP SUPPORT
Reviews.Author: Matthew Dean Berkland
Reviews.Content: iphone and ipad application support for this product does not seem to be there yet.  Do not recommend, buy the 8910W model instead.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: Rob S.
Reviews.Content: Amazon really needs a no-star rating.  I rate this a one-star under protest.If you are looking for a camera that:- sometimes works in displaying an image- has certain functions that never work- has an issues list 84 pages long on the Foscam support forum- is rendered completely useless (bricked) after a firmware updatethen this is the camera for you.I've had this camera about 4 months.  The first month or two was awful.  The camera would not stay connected to a very strong wifi signal and did not have the smarts to reconnect on it's own.  Foscam released a firmware upgrade that helped it reconnect so that issue was solved for the most part.  I still needed to reboot the thing manually every week or so.  This is not a camera that is to be relied upon, so if that is your goal....do not buy this camera.  I bought it as a baby monitor so it only needed to stay connected through the night....which it rarely did.Foscam released another firmware update (1.1.1.13) in June.  I thought that maybe this would help with some of my issues.  I upgraded the firmware following their instructions exactly.  The camera interface stated that the upgrade was successful and that the camera was rebooting.  After that, bye bye camera.  It appears to be up and running and grabs an IP address from my router.  However, it cannot be connected to via any means (their MyIP Camera tool, the web interface, CGI commands).  No amount of factory resets helped.So now I have to pay to ship this piece of garbage back to Foscam so they can fix it.  Believe the other reviewers who say that this camera is not ready for prime time....100% the truth.

Reviews.Title: Once again I ordered this camera because I like true color.
Reviews.Author: Michel J. Ferris
Reviews.Content: I have an older PT Foscam that is not true color. After replacing some of my stationary cams with true color I became addictied to the idea that all my cams need to be that way.  I purchased this one and have had it about 2 weeks now.  Dispite having so much trouble with the Foscam's 18903's I am still riding on the idea that all my older cam's are Foscam and they worked great.I love my 18918w Pt cam but once again it isn't true color.Back to the new 19821.  It is a great cam.  The picture and the audio are fantastic.  I wish Foscam would work on a zoom but other than that it's just what you're looking for.  Now....this morning when I looked on my phone for this cam it was gone.  So I looked on my home network and it was not visable there either.  I powered it down and back up and it reappeared.  This is the same problem that I had with the 18903's that I finally replaced with Agasio 603's but with those cam's the reboot started from the very beginning.I don't want to have to worry about having someone reboot my camera's while I'm off on a trip somewhere.  The whole reason I have them is so I can monitor my home while away.  If they keep blinking out then they are of no use to me.  This 19821 has only done it once but now I'm suspious that it will do it again.  I guess time will tell.  I have a couple more weekd before I get to the poin that I can't return it.  If it blinks off one more time it'll be back in the box and on it's way back.

Reviews.Title: Terrible camera
Reviews.Author: Rita
Reviews.Content: Dont waste your money on this terrible camera. The resolution is SD not HD. I was very disappointed with this camera. I really wanted to like this camera but it just didn't work.  So i am returning it.

Reviews.Title: Nice web cam
Reviews.Author: Marty
Reviews.Content: This is my third web cam purchase from this company. Devices are getting improved over time. This one has good video quality. Would reccomend. The sound/microphone quality is slightly better than previous models, but not perfect.

Reviews.Title: Works fine
Reviews.Author: LA Photo Ltd "Photographer"
Reviews.Content: This is the camera to get from Foscam Spring 2013. It is not as good as some of the other brands in terms of quality or compatibility with security recorders, but for the money it is just fine. The free apps for ipad work with it just fine, while some of the paid ones actually had trouble talking to the high res stream.I would say day time colors are ok to good, but night time IR illuminated view is excellent compared to other cameras I've tried.Definitely worth the money, but be prepared for a bit clunky interface.

Reviews.Title: worked ok until it died
Reviews.Author: oc
Reviews.Content: It's been about 3 and a half months. Getting my mac to work with the camera was a bit of pain but it worked fine on the PC by following the instructions. I haven't used it to record anything just live monitoring. It seemed to work fine until it died. It's constantly looping the start sequence where the camera rotates up/down and left/right. It's not available on the network and resetting doesn't help. I've found other users having the same problem on Foscam's forums. A few complained about having sent their camera in but haven't gotten the replacement. I'm just starting the replacement process so I hope it goes well.

Reviews.Title: Review for Foscam
Reviews.Author: Dp Bob
Reviews.Content: The Foscam equipment is excellent, easy to use, and the customer service department is wonderful.  They spent the time to help me step by step to get setup with my new camera.  I really like the convenience of being able to monitor my home through my iphone.  Thank you Foscam.  Great product, excellent service, superior company.  - Robert, Atlanta, Ga

Reviews.Title: All features that I wanted had been checked out fine
Reviews.Author: menlo101
Reviews.Content: I had been testing this camera for few days and many features worked fine. There is an User's guide online in PDF format to setup the camera. The User's guide didn't come with the box. I updated it to latest software/firmware version and the picture is certainly better than VGA model, more pixels (720p) increase the sharpness. The important features such as motion alarm, sending pictures to email, recording to HCSD card, FTP to SAN, controlling and viewing remotely with Android/iOS cell phones worked fine for me, there was no need to call for phone support. So it's 4 stars for the price. I will get the 2nd one soon.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for watching backyard from anywhere
Reviews.Author: Raymond John Thoen
Reviews.Content: Very clear picture during daylight the wider angle lens is only disappointment . Had to do a bit of searching to find app that works with Ipad ufoscam works well

Reviews.Title: Basic device due diligence not covered
Reviews.Author: Mike Power
Reviews.Content: Any device like this runs with firmware embedded inside of it. It is basic due diligence when producing a device for the end consumer to ensure that firmware updates work. The user can go to a device admin page, check for updates, download updates and install those updates.This device fails at all three.1) Once on the admin page it will tell you what firmware version it is. But it won't be able to check for updates. It does not even give a link. Not even to a generic manufacturer support page. You have to google the device and then scan down the search results to find the manufacturer's page.  Then you have to browse around to find the download link.  Here is the kicker, when you click the download link they demand that you sign up your email for marketing updates before they give you the firmware.At this point there is no use going forward.  Any company stupid enough to require their users to sign up for marketing updates to simply patch their hardware is not worth doing business with.  I look at the bright side, I just saved you $110.Note: I got a ASUS (RT-AC68U) Wireless-AC1900 Dual-Band Gigabit Router and it does a fine job checking for, downloading, and updating updates all by itself. It is a very fine piece of equipment.

Reviews.Title: FI9821W
Reviews.Author: john marshall
Reviews.Content: I had issues with port forwarding for my fi9821W cameras.I called foscam & the tech support  helped me with the setting.I have three more to go.

Reviews.Title: Video quality OK, but..
Reviews.Author: Mark "Mark"
Reviews.Content: No complaints about the video quality - it is very nice.  But the camera has two issues.  First, it makes a continual grinding noise.  You don't hear it unless the room is quiet but it is very noticeable if it is.  The second issue is that the power cord is way too short to locate and mount it.  Less of an issue is that it required multiple firmware updates in order to become usable.  Ideally that shouldn't be the case, but I am used to dealing with that.

Reviews.Title: foscam
Reviews.Author: leigh
Reviews.Content: excellent product service...very attentive and diligent to get the job done!good camera..great price.piece of mind when away from home. easy to install

Reviews.Title: Beware fake reviews
Reviews.Author: jaknell1011
Reviews.Content: All signs point to fake reviews being written for this item. Beware.Please note I have not purchased this item because of most reviews of people having the same problems, so I gave the item 3 stars to not affect the rating too much.Some of the good reviews on this item seem fake, with many fakes mentioning customer service. Check other sites reviews of this item before you buy. You can't trust all of the ones on Amazon anymore.

Reviews.Title: The camera is fine.  Set up is a hell!
Reviews.Author: hesty24
Reviews.Content: You have to call the tech support center to get this thing up and running, and if you want to remotely (iphone, droid, etc.) view, you are definitely going to need some networking/ router adjustment experience.  I am pretty good with techy stuff, but this is why out of my league.  I wouldn't recommend this camera, if you need a plug n' play type device.  Look into a newer Logitech system.  Less functions on the Logitech, but user friendly.  Oh yea, when you need help with the call center tech support, DON'T tell them you bought it on Amazon or Ebay or etc.  Just tell them that you bought it directly from Foscam.  Reason: they won't help you if you don't by it direct <<< Ain't that some $H(#!!!!

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: wilson
Reviews.Content: very good

Reviews.Title: 100% satisfied...
Reviews.Author: Bijan Shams
Reviews.Content: I never spend time to leave feedbacks but in this case i had to write my opinion; Very trustable camera and definitely exceptional manufacturing...tried many other cameras in past 20 years but this one has really impressed me the most. Works perfectly well and there technical support in India amazed me how they set the system up in less than 10 minutes...and since last 10 days working flawlessly none stop...dont spend time to set it up yourself just call them to login to your pc and in a snap you are out of the door with completly educated like you are doing yourself...

Reviews.Title: Foscam- A lot of technology for the money
Reviews.Author: J. P. Profilet "walking woman"
Reviews.Content: I bought this cam on a whim, mostly to explore networking concepts and ways to use the web. What I found here is an amazing amount of technology in a small package at an agreeable price point. I came away with a clear understanding of internal/external IP addresses, their relationships to ports, port forwarding configuring alarms and email notifications was a plus. What I have to show for it is a great little cam that I use for security and an additional window into my yard. (I hung this under my eaves).Support was great and answered some of my crazy questions with patience.Would recommend you buy this from Foscam if you aren't very technical.

Reviews.Title: very good technical support from foscam company
Reviews.Author: Shih-kuan Hsu
Reviews.Content: chris johnsonThank you very much for your help, even I waited more than 30 minutes to  ,connect the call to technical support. it is worth to wait.The camera I bought is very clear compare to other brands.

Reviews.Title: Great customer support
Reviews.Author: 06attaker
Reviews.Content: If you don't know about port forwarding pay for the customer remote support for $40.  Well worth the money.  I got 3 cameras set up in under half hour.  Allen was my customer support tech.  Great service and is 24 hour 7 days.  Foscam has come along way with tutorials and setups online as well.

Reviews.Title: tech support on foscam
Reviews.Author: Gerald Caccavaro
Reviews.Content: To all concerned with tech support from Foscam: Myself being mildly technichal I find the process of setting up "port forwarding" on a Web Cam to be a daunting task. I can not say enough about phone support from Foscam. I'm Very Thankful for the high quality of the product and the Tech Support rendered by Allen Smith of Foscam.

Reviews.Title: Foscam makes life great
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I have the ability to remotely change the direction and view my office area from any computer, Ipad or Iphone what a great way to monitor my belongings. Quick and easy!!!

Reviews.Title: camera customer support
Reviews.Author: jason m. Ehret
Reviews.Content: was helped by calvin, did a great job. good customer support for this product. the camera is great too. works great and good price, with a very clear picture. i would highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Good customer service
Reviews.Author: Kurt Houben
Reviews.Content: I was able to have my problem fixed by Irish at Foscam quickly even at 8:31PM on a Monday evening.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Brandon
Reviews.Content: Product was DOA.  Their customer support was horrible.  I spent 45 minutes on hold to wait to talk to someone who fumbled for an hour before they acknowledged it was a lemon.  Read other reviews.

Reviews.Title: Foscam - do not buy ******
Reviews.Author: Stephen W. Geddes
Reviews.Content: I just got the camera set up after stumbling a bit in the initial set up process (camera should be at least 5 ft away from router). I called tech support (Harry Foster) who made it a breeze to get my camera working. They did everything by remote viewer so I was able to watch as Harry was in control of my computer installing the latest firmware and checking my ip address and router set up. If you are not a techie yourself, then no worries as you can just call them and they will direct you to a website, click a button, give them the code and they will do the set up remotely. The camera is great (love that you can remote control it). Home security is important and I already have external cameras - I bought this model for the inside. I like the fact that there is a sd card slot so it will record onboard as well. Great product (***wait, read updates below***) and as mentioned great tech support (only had to wait about 2 mins to get a rep).  Highly recommend.Update 10/25/2013I am sadly changing this from 5 stars to 1. I was impressed originally with how the tech support got the camera up and running remotely, however, out of 2 cameras ordered, I am now on my 3rd replacement and the wifi just cut out so I may be looking at a 4th replacement. I have tried calling tech support for the last 1 1/2 hours and I'm just getting a busy signal. The 1st replacement was due to the SD Card reader not working. The next two replacements were because the camera would not connect and when I tried turning off and on and resetting they would just continuously spin around. I hope this wifi issue I currently have will be an easy fix if I can get in touch with tech support. I would not purchase this camera again as they obviously have quality control issues. My second last replacement was Version 2 and it seems to be ok at the moment. I wish you all the best luck if you get Version 1. I am also a little angry at myself because the 3rd time I sent back the camera I forgot to remove the SD Card (32gb) and when I asked if they could send it back, I was told "sorry, the box has already been opened", so it cost me another $20 for a new card, that was my bad.Update 11/09/2013I did get through to tech support on 10/25 and they were as always very helpful and got the camera running again. No issues so far and both cameras are performing as they should.Update 2/22/2014Well, the wifi option of the camera konked out again and I called tech support. The first person struggled for a while and when I later mentioned this was the 3rd replacement the line disconnected or dropped, whatever. I called back again and got a different tech support guy who again went through various things. After a good 10 minutes he seemed stumped and again I mentioned this current camera is my 3rd replacement - the line dropped. I am giving up on the wifi which is the whole reason why I bought this camera. I am going to have to relocate the camera in a spot I really did not want to locate it to only because I will now have to rely on a hardwire (ethernet cable). This camera model was a nice idea but it always fails. I was tempted to call back and ask for another replacement (there is a newer version) but am tired of paying $15 postage each time and with this track record, could not trust it to be reliable. 0 out of 5 stars!Update 3/10/2014Hardwired my Foscam, external viewing still not working. At least the alarm setting with email is working or rather was - it worked for all of 1 day before the whole camaera went kaput! Now I get" Oops! Google Chrome could not connect to (ip address)". I called my folks who's last replacement was version 2  only to find out theirs had developed the same problem as a previous one of the camera continually swivelling around searching. We are fed up giving Foscam a chance and paying for all these return shippings. An original order of 2 Foscams gave way to a total of 5 Foscam units with the replacements, none of which now work. Ridiculous! If anyone knows of a reliable manufacturer of an internal home security cam, please let me know.

Reviews.Title: Customer service
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: Sandra was a big help. I had an issue with my Foscam 9821 when I lost power at my house and it reset. She was able to get me back online and running again. I love to be able to view my house from my phone when I'm away.

Reviews.Title: owner
Reviews.Author: david
Reviews.Content: the camera works fine customer service is great no hassel can connect to my android phone right away didn't struggle at all would recommend it to friends

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: I've had many IP cameras (Trendnet and Foscam) and this was the easiest to install and operate. The resolution is 720 and is a nice improvement over the standard 480.

Reviews.Title: Great service
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Calvin took great care of me and made me like the camera.This  product is not simple in it's set-up, but the company has clearly taken steps to fix that through their tech support.

Reviews.Title: excellent rvice
Reviews.Author: hbbbernard
Reviews.Content: Cavin very good.. Very helpfull with my problem. service was excellent.I couldn't fix it without his helpcameras work well!Thanks

Reviews.Title: foscam service
Reviews.Author: gary sacks
Reviews.Content: geat camera and great service.Very clear pic.cam could use a wider lens, but overall performance is good. Took a bit to get going, but tech helped me.

Reviews.Title: a good product but needs customer support help
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Marturet
Reviews.Content: I have tried other similar products and this, is for sure, one the best of its kind in terms of video quality, apps, pan/tilt, and price. It even has a great function for 2 way audio which can be very useful and is rarely found in similar products.However the major problem is that, unless you have a great deal of technical knowledge, it is very difficult to set up the wireless configuration without tech support.Fortunately FOSCAM customer support service proved to be excellent. Although call waiting was long, once I got to talk to a real person they where able to solve my technical problems real quick.

Reviews.Title: Foscam
Reviews.Author: supedve
Reviews.Content: had some trouble out of the box but the tech tema has been faboulous gettingme setup and making it useable, ready to start watching my dog now and see what she does during the day.

Reviews.Title: OKAY
Reviews.Author: Nonoma
Reviews.Content: I've had many tech issues and customer service is a nightmare but once I get through, the reps have been helpful (if you can get past the minor language barriers).

Reviews.Title: Foscam fi9821w
Reviews.Author: L. Estevez "lou34"
Reviews.Content: The camera not a bad item since it has wifi but issues come when you use a Mac the software got upgraded but won't let u get motion email on Mac. The customer service wait is tremendous and then they don't listen to what you are saying. They claim app is iphone/ipad compatible this is absolutely false.  If you are using this cam for security it will let you view it in the house but of what use is this.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Technical Suport
Reviews.Author: Connie Sun
Reviews.Content: I needed help with setting up the camera to access if from outside my home network and also from my iPhone. I am very satisfied with Ralph Mendez's service.I think this is a good camera. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI9821W
Reviews.Author: Betty
Reviews.Content: This is a really great camera for the price, the quality and functions it is top notch! I received awesome customer support from foscam. I would definitely recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the cost!
Reviews.Author: Charles Ramsey
Reviews.Content: Good 720p picture quality, and really good software. Far better than the cheap Chinese versions. Foscam also has great tech support!

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: marvin gordon
Reviews.Content: I only thing I don't like about the IP camera is that it is not secure. what I mean is it is "http" instead of "https". Also when I call the help desk to get direction partifiic things about the camera, I have yet to get a responce back. Other than that, the camera is good and I do like it.

Reviews.Title: Foscam F19821W support
Reviews.Author: ralis24
Reviews.Content: Called support for an issue with the camera.  Support was quick and friendly and the problem was resolved quickly.  Great camera!  Works well.

Reviews.Title: foscam
Reviews.Author: Keith
Reviews.Content: I  really like the help that I had today by Calvian. He helped me with making my foscam wifi. I really like the fact that I can watch my house from any where I go..

Reviews.Title: Technical Support
Reviews.Author: Trey Koury
Reviews.Content: Cameras are easy setup for initial install. Calvin on technical support team did a great job in helping with issues.

Reviews.Title: Foscam support
Reviews.Author: doc
Reviews.Content: I just purchased the foscam camera and asked the support to help me upgrade to the 1.1.1.11 firmware which they did remotely.  They did a great job.  thanks

Reviews.Title: FOSCAM F19821W
Reviews.Author: Anthony T
Reviews.Content: I purchased the FOSCAM F19821W cameras to provide basic peace of mind for my residence.  But I had some difficultly configuring multi-cameras as I purchased three (3) cameras.
